mkdocs_workflow

Source: vignettes/mkdocs_workflow.Rmd
mkdocs_workflow.Rmd
library(docmaker)

mkdocs set-up and workflow

  • To build the site:
mkdocs build
  • To push the site
mkdocs gh-deploy --strict --force

GitHub pages

To allow your repository to be build as a static web page, you can follow the instructions from github pages

Setting your repo with mkdocs

Once you clone your repository, go to your directory and in the terminal use the following command, tha it will create all the initial documents:

$mkdocs new .

All the documentation about mkdocs is here

After you have your repository set up, you can serve the site with:

$mkdocs serve

This will create all the static web page files and deploy locally the site. You can check your served site on: http://127.0.0.1:8000/

Using material theme

If you don’t like the default theme for your static web page, you can use many other themes. Here I used the material theme. All documentation can be found here

To install the theme:

pip install mkdocs-material

Then, on your project yml file, you need to include the following:

theme:
  name: material

Deploying your site

Now we are set. After you have your files ready, you need to send everything to github:

$mkdocs gh-deploy

We should see a message like this one:

INFO     -  Your documentation should shortly be available at: https://ronnyhdez.github.io/draweR/

Don’t control version your site folder!

Don’t forget to put on your .gitignore file the site folder

On this page
